_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 4th, 1:39 PM
Good afternoon Sugarbush skiers and riders! Its the final day of the holiday week, what better excuse to soak up the magic of Sugarbush before heading back to work or school? Forecast for tomorrow calls for yet another cold one. Cloudy skies will be accompanied by temps in the mid to low teens at the base and single digits at the summit, plus we'll see snow showers begin in the afternoon carrying into the evening. You can look forward to sliding on some firm and fast groomers tomorrow, along with variable conditions found on natural terrain. Snowmaking will be staying on Birch Run and Northridge Expressway.

We have over 450 skiable acres served by 13 lifts and 106 open trails, with 41 of those getting a fresh corduroy overnight. Castlerock lift will be spinning tomorrow from 9:00 AM - 3:45 PM. Ropes dropped on tons of natural terrain this week including Moonshine, Hammerhead, Tumbler, The Mall and more. This terrain is suggested for experts only as base coverage is thin and conditions are variable. Check out Ripcord today as snowmaking whales were groomed out overnight.

Operations are moving back to weekday hours, which means GMX is our early bird, loading at 8:00 AM. Followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM. Inverness and Racer's Edge trails will be closed to the public until 12:00 PM due to race training. Sugar Run will also be closed tomorrow as the Park's crew will be setting up features for your delight later this week. Sugarbush offers a diverse range of freestyle parks, whether youre just starting out or training for competitions, weve got you covered. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 64 features on Riemergasse and a few sprinkled on Straightshot, while Lincoln Peak is home to two mini parks featuring 12 creative elements.

 Join us this afternoon, from 3:004:00 PM, at the surface lift, Easy Up at Mt. Ellen for sled rides with our Ski Patrol! As part of NSAA Safety Month, meet the team, learn about their work, and enjoy a fun, unique experience on the mountain. Dont forget to bring your Blizzard Bingo card, available at Guest Services, and check off another activity! Check out all of our winter events!

All uphill routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, check out our uphill travel policy for more info. *Lincoln Peak evening route will stop at the top of Gate House, due to snowmaking on North Lynx terrain*
